description:
The ‘Landmarks: Boston’ app is perfect for tourists, tour guides, architects, historic preservationists, urban planners, realtors, renters & homebuyers, and anyone else curious about Boston’s architectural history. 

Landmarks: Boston lists the official landmarked buildings and sites near you, anywhere in the city. It tells you when each landmark was designated (some more than 30 years ago!), provides detailed info such as which portion of the site is landmarked and what parcel it’s located on, and provides links to Wikipedia & the Boston landmarks website. Thumbnail photos from Wikipedia are displayed for almost half the landmarked sites, plus links to hi-res images.  You can view each location on a map, and email details about the landmark with just a single tap. 

The app is focused on city-designated landmarks, but future updates will likely include: 
+ locations from the National Register of Historic Places; 
+ integrated walking tour suggestions; and/or 
+ a nationwide version. 

Feedback and suggestions are greatly appreciated!
